OwnerUser.AboutMe:
Self-taught programmer since 2006, working at Stremor. Apart from coding, I'm obsessed with learning languages, linguistics, long-distance running, photography, and hiking / geocaching.

At present I work with several technologies in the same product:

  • Python (natural language processing on Google App Engine)
  • PhoneGap (browser-side JavaScript / CoffeeScript with a bridge to Objective-C on iOS)

Proficient in:

  • JavaScript + HTML + CSS (2006)
  • PHP (2006)
  • Java (2009)
  • Ruby (2010)
  • Clojure (2011)
  • Objective-C (2011)
  • Python (2011)

Body:
Wikipedia's page on lenition seems to suggest that a /t/ -> /θ/ change can actually come from a /t/ -> /tθ/ (affrication) -> /θ/ (spiratization) change.

I don't know enough to confirm or deny that this is what Grimm's law describes. I assume if this were true the /tθ/ step would be part of the law.
